page.title: 10ST HIERITHA CHURCH
page.content: CHITTLEHAMPTON CHURCH-St Hieritha or to use the more correct form St Urith. Her legend closely resembling that of St Sidwell of Exeter is given in the Latin hymn discovered in 15th century manuscript at Trinity College Cambridge in 1901. Little known about her life. There is an ancient figure of her on the pulpit. She was perhaps a convert of St Kea St Fili and St Rumon missionaries from Glastonbury who came here in the 6th century. Westcote(b.1567) speaks of Chittlehampton as a village famous for St Hieritha whose miracles are able to fill a whole legend who lived there and was buried there. The inscription painted in 1764 on the empty niche by her shrine shows that her name was then still revered. Risdon(1630) says she was born at Stowford. Celebrations for St Hieritha are on 8th July.
